pullRequest.title: Obfuscate sensitive login information in debug logs
pullRequest.bodyText:
Added selective logcat obfuscation for login details such as username, password or tokens.
Logs are disabled by default in release mode but not in debug. Additionally, those logs might show sensitive information about the user running a Realm app. These details have been obfuscated even when the log level is set to DEBUG.
Obfuscation does not take place in tests, as the LoggingInterceptor isn't provided a feature to obfuscate in the AppConfig object that initiates a TestApp.
In order to integration-test the solution, the TestLogger helper had to be modified to include the previous RealmLog entry too, as some operations, e.g. login, send more than one request in the same batch, therefore not allowing us to check the very last message that was dumped into the logcat.

commit.message: Added support for server api keys and custom functions as valid credentials
Fixed breaking changes after updating with v10

Added identity provider to OsAppCredential to distinguish between user and server API keys, as the value is the same for both in the OS but are treated as separate providers. Cleaned up some comments. Removed unnecessary log in tests plus added comparison at enum level
Fixed typo in jwt creds test and changed comparison of users to their ids instead of the whole object
Updated OS pointer to latest v10
Move identity provider from OS to API level
Added logcat obfuscators. Added a default map to the AppConfiguration to allow logs to not be obfuscated in tests.
Wrapped the patterns and providers inside a LoginInfoObfuscator class for clarity
Added missing javadoc and fixed static code analysis issue

You seem to test all the relevant things, but I'm a bit concerned there are no proper integration tests. The reason being that if ObjectStore at some point changes which payload is sent to the server, we will not detect this and these obfuscators will fail to do the right thing.
We don't need to test all the error cases, but IMO we should test the happy path towards a real server.

Added integration tests and more cleanup
Removed set loglevel from credentials test
Fixed wrong references in unit test

nodes.bodyText:
I'm a bit uneasy about this API:

Calling it loggingInterceptor is a bit too generic. It only works for http requests, not all logs. Maybe rename to httpLoggingInterceptor?
It taking a LoggingInterceptor as argument is a bit weird as LoggingInterceptor is not an interface but an actual class that people cannot really customize. Should this just have been Interceptor ? But Interceptor is an interface from OkHttp. I would a be a bit uneasy about letting that be part of our public API as we are then bound by that contract.
This factory method feels a bit weird to have public? Since it doesn't really work for any other "feature"?

Moved classes to their rightful packages plus a bit of cleanup
